Meaning: [부]east of [sth] (to the east of [sth])~의 동쪽으로 | [형]east of [sth] (in an easterly direction from [sth])~의 동쪽에 | 있는 | [형](of the east)동쪽의, 동쪽에 있는 | [형](not difficult)쉬운 | [형](comfortable)안락한, 편안한 | [형](sufficiently wealthy) (돈)여유로운
Example: The rich people live east of the river. | Great Britain is east of Ireland. | The east wind is usually quite cold. | Correcting the spelling was an easy job. | He sat in his easy chair and watched TV. | Yes, we have an easy life here.

Meaning: [형](relaxed)편안한 | [형]slang (promiscuous)문란한 | [부](gently, with moderation)가벼이 | [동(타)]eat [sth] (consume a food)~을 먹다 | [동(타)]eat [sth] (food: chew and swallow)(행동에 초점)~을 먹
Example: It was a nice, easy atmosphere at the party. | The rumour was that she was easy. | I'm taking it easy tonight because I have to drive home. | I eat pasta every day.

Meaning: 다 | [동(자)](consume food) (행위 자체에 초점)먹다 | [명](egg eaten as food)달걀, 계란, 알 | [명](bird, reptile: shell with embryo)알
Example: I have difficulty eating meat because of my loose teeth. | I'm hungry. Let's eat! | She ate two boiled eggs for breakfast. | Most birds lay their eggs in the spring.

Meaning: [명](woman, female mammal: ovum)난자 | [동(타)]egg [sth] (cookery: coat in egg)~에 계란을 입히다 | [명](cardinal number: 8)8, 팔 | [명](symbol for number 8)8 | [명](time: 8 o'clock)8시, 여덟 시
Example: A woman has a set number of eggs that she is born with. | First you egg the chicken pieces, then you roll them in flour. | Eight minus five is three. | Ben's handwriting is so bad that his eight looks like a six. | We arranged to meet at eight in the evening.

Meaning: [명(대)](people, things: 8 of them)8개, 8명 | [명]US, written (eighth day of specified month)8일 | [명]mainly UK, written (eighth day of specified month)8일 | [명](cardinal number: 18)숫자 18 | [형](18 in number)18의 | [형](18 years of age)18세의 | [명(대)](people, things: 18 of them) (사람)18명
Example: Can you find the eight differences between these two | pictures? | The exhibit is open from January 8 through February 7. | The singer John Lennon died on 8 December 1980. | Thirty minus twelve equals eighteen. | Eighteen people were standing in line when the door opened. | I voted for the first time when I was eighteen.

Meaning: [명]US, written (eighteenth day of specified month) (특정한 달 | 의)18일 | [명]mainly UK, written (eighteenth day of specified month) (특 | 정한 달의)18일 | [명](cardinal number: 80)80, 팔십 | [형](80 in number)80의 | [형](80 years of age)80세의
Example: Eighteen of the students failed the exam. | The movie is released on Friday, June 18. | This passport expired on 18 February 2017. | Sixty plus twenty equals eighty. | There are about eighty households in the village. | We had a big party when grandma turned eighty.

Meaning: [명(복)]the eighties, the '80s (decade: 1980s)1980년대, 80년 | 대 | [명(복)]your eighties, your 80s (age: 80-89 years)80대 | [명(대)](people, things: 80 of them) (사람)80명
Example: Miranda looks older, but actually she was born in the eighties. | Dr. Smith plays many sports, including golf; she is enjoying | her eighties to the full. | Eighty of the students failed the exam.

Meaning: [명](large pachyderm)코끼리 | An elephant at the zoo gave birth last week.

[명(대)](people, things: 11 of them) (사람)11명,(사물)11개 | [명]US, written (eleventh day of specified month) (특정한 달 | 의)11일 | [명]mainly UK, written (eleventh day of specified month) (특정 | 한 달의)11일 | [형](thing other than)그 밖에, 달리, 대신에
Example: It's Agatha's birthday tomorrow; she'll be eleven. | Eleven of the students failed the exam. | The First World War came to an end on November 11, 1918. | Sadly, Aunt Josephine died on 11 March. | I can't wear that pink dress! Have you got anything else?

Meaning: [형](in addition to) (부가적으로)이외에 | [명]email,e-mail (electronic message)e-메일 | [명]email,e-mail(electronic messaging system)이메일, 전자 우 | 편 | [명]email,e-mail: informal (electronic messaging address)e-메 | 일 주소
Example: I'll take the apples, but what else do you have? | I received an email from John with the directions to the party. | Our server is down and we're without email. | If you give me your email, I'll send the invitation to you.

Meaning: [동(타)]email [sb] (send electronic message)~에게 메세지를 | 보내다 | [동(타)]email [sb] [sth] (send: to [sb] via email)이메일로 ~에게 | ~을 보내다 | [동(타)]email [sth] to [sb] (send: [sth] via email)~을 e-메일로 | 보내다 | [명](conclusion)종료, 결론, 종결 | [명](furthest part)끝 | [명](limit: time) (시간)말 | [명]figurative (limit, bounds) (비유)한계, 한도, 끝
Example: I'll email you tomorrow with the details. | I will email you the directions. | I'll email the invoices to all our customers. | The story gripped me from the opening line right to the end. | They live at the end of the street. | We're moving at the end of the month. | Is there no end to our problems?

Meaning: [명](outcome)결과 | [명](tip, extremity)끝, 첨단 | [동(타)]end [sth] (bring to a conclusion)~을 끝내다 | [동(자)](finish)끝나다, 마치다 | [동(타)]enjoy [sth] (take pleasure in)~을 즐기다, 즐겁게 ~하다 | [동(타)]enjoy [sth] (have as a benefit)~을 누리다, ~을 지니다,
Example: Does the end justify the means? | You should place the end of the board against the wall. | She ended their relationship after just two months. | The concert ended with a Mozart violin concerto. | I always enjoy a good book.

Meaning: ~을 유지하다 | [감]Enjoy! (have fun, take pleasure) (구어체)즐거운 시간 보 | 내! | [형](sufficient)충분한, 넉넉한 | [명(대)](sufficiency)충분한 양, 넉넉한 양
Example: I've always enjoyed good health. | I'll pick you up when the movie's finished. Enjoy! | Do we have enough money for this meal? | I pray that we always have enough to live on.

Meaning: [부](sufficiently)~할 만큼, 충분히, 넉넉하게 | [부](tolerably)충분히 | [감](that is sufficient)됐어, 충분해, 이제 그만
Example: He worked enough to support his family. | It's interesting enough, but I still don't want to buy it. | Enough! I don't want to hear any more!

Meaning: [명](European Union currency)유로 | You can exchange any euros you have left at the airport. | [부](still, yet)훨씬, 더, 게다가 | [부](including: extreme case)심지어 | [부](despite)~에도 불구하고 | [형](flat)평평한, 평면의 | [형](uniform)고른, 균일한, 똑같은
Example: I feel even worse than I look. | It was so easy, even a child could do it. | He didn't leave her even after all she had said. | This floor's not very even. | Apply the paint in an even layer over the surface.

Meaning: [형](level)평평한 | [형](no fluctuations)한결같은, 규칙적인 | [형]mainly US (equal in quantity)같은 양의, 균등한 | [형](sports: tied)동점의, 대등한, 비기는 | [형](number: divisible by two)짝수의 | [명](late day and early night)저녁
Example: When you hang the curtains, remember that the curtain rod | and the top of the window should be even. | His pulse was very even. | Add an even mixture of milk and cream. | She was winning a moment ago but now they're even. | Since there's an even number of us we can work in pairs. | It is beautiful here in the evening. | He could still see well in the evening light.

Meaning: [명](light: twilight)해질녘 | [명](before nightfall: on given day)오후 | [명]([sth] planned)행사, 이벤트 | [명](occurrence)사건, 사태
Example: Saturday evening is the best time for relaxing in front of the | TV. | Here's the schedule of events for the next season. | Recent world events have been quite worrying.

Meaning: [명(복)]events (things that happen)사건 | [명](sports competition)경기, 시합 | [부](at any time)여태까지 | [부](of all time, in history)역사상 | [부](emphatic: never) (강조)결코

[명(대)](every person)모든 이, 모든 사람들, 모두 | Everyone wants to come to the party. | [명(대)](all things)모든 것, 모두
Example: Everything went wrong.

Meaning: [명(대)]figurative (the only thing important)전부 | [명]figurative (what is most important)가장 중요한 것 | [명]colloquial, abbreviation (test of knowledge)시험, 고사

Meaning: [명](typical instance)예, 예문 | Today's changing weather is an example of coastal climate. | [형](animated, enthusiastic)흥분한 | [형](agitated)동요한, 흥분한 | [형](sexually aroused) (성적으로)흥분한

Meaning: [형](thrilling)짜릿한, 흥미진진한 | [명]uncountable (physical activity)운동 | [명]often plural (physical movement for fitness)운동 | [명](mental activity) (정신적)훈련, 연마 | [명](training, homework)연습 | [명]an exercise in [sth] (project, endeavor)~을 위한 일, ~을 위

Meaning: 한 활동 | [명]uncountable (application, use)행사, 발휘 | [명(복)]exercises (military) (군대)훈련 | [동(자)](do physical activity)운동하다 | [동(타)]exercise [sth] (use, call upon) (권리를)행사하다

Example: I've tried to explain Einstein's Theory of Relativity to her many | times, but she still doesn't understand it. | Can you explain what happened to the money? | The bullying she experienced in her teens explains her | shyness now. | Why did you take my car without asking? Explain yourself! | She received extra pay for the additional hours that she | worked. | He had been involved in an extra-marital affair. | She wasn't just a star. She had that something extra.

Example: Keith must be an avid reader, as he has a quantity of books | on his shelves. | Victoria was queen of England.

Meaning: [명](wife of a king) (왕의 부인으로서)왕비, 왕후 | [부](without sound)조용히

Meaning: [부](talk)조용히, 조용조용히

Meaning: [동(타)]race [sth] (ride or drive in a race) (경주)~에 출전하다, | 레이스에 나가다 | [동(타)]race [sth] (make an animal compete)~을 경주하게 하 | 다 | [동(타)]race [sb/sth] (compete against)~와 경쟁하다 | [동(자)](compete)경주하다, 경쟁하다

Meaning: [명](railroad track, network)철도, 철도선, 철길, 철로, 레일 | The country's railways were in a poor state of repair. | [동(타)]raise [sth] (height: increase) (높이를)~을 높이다, ~을 | 올리다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (lift into air)~을 들다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (increase: volume) (소리를)~을 높이다, ~을 | 올리다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (intensity: increase) (정도)~을 높이다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (salary: increase) (임금)~을 올리다, ~을 인 | 상하다
Example: We raised the beach umbrella by six inches. | Raise your hand if you have a question. | Would you raise the volume so I can hear it? | Guys, we need to raise our level of play or we won't win the | game.

Meaning: [동(타)]raise [sth] (money: collect) (돈)~을 모으다, ~을 모금하 | 다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (price, rent: increase) (가격, 비용 등을)~을 | 올리다, ~을 상승시키다 | [동(타)]raise [sb] (children: rear)~을 키우다, ~을 양육하다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (crops: cultivate) (식물)~을 경작하다, ~을 | 재배하다 | [동(타)]raise [sth] (head: tilt upwards) (머리, 고개)~을 들다 | [명](measurement, ratio) (측정)비율, 율 | [명](price, fee)요금, 가격 | [명](speed, pace)속도, 진도 | [동(타)]rate [sth/sb] (film, etc.: classify)~을 심의하다 | [동(타)]rate [sth] (evaluate)~을 평가하다 | [동(타)]rate [sth] [sth] (book, film: give a rating) (점수)~을 ~에
Example: The company raised everybody's salary by 3%. | We raised five thousand dollars for the charity. | The landlord raised the rent by one hundred dollars a month. | We raised the children to be respectful of their parents. | Many farmers in Ohio raise corn. | He raised his head once he heard his name. | The birth rate is steadily increasing. | What is your rate for this service? | The rate of growth is amazing. | All new films must be rated by the censors before they can be | screened in public.

Meaning: 주다 | [동(타)]rate [sth] [sth], rate [sth] as [sth] (film, etc.: classify)~ | 을 ~로 심의하다 | [명(복)]rates: UK (property tax)지방세 | [동(타)]rate [sb/sth] [sth], rate [sb/sth] as [sth] (be ranked) (순 | 위)~가 ~에 오르다 | [명(복)]rates: UK (public utility charges)요금 | [부](to some degree)꽤, 다소, 어느 정도 | [부](prefer)~보다는 차라리, 오히려
Example: The boss will rate your performance. | I rate this book five stars. | The board rated the movie "R." | Rates are levied on business property. | He rates second in the world. | Rates are high for property in this area. | He was rather disturbed by the images of the war. I am rather | annoyed by your attitude. | I know you wanted to see that film, but I'd rather see this one.

Meaning: [접]rather than (in preference to)~보다 | [접]rather than (in contrast to) (비교)~보다 | [동(타)]reach [sth] (get to, arrive at)~에 도착하다 | [동(타)]reach [sth] (extend arm)손을 뻗다, (결과, 총계 등) ~에 | 이르다 | [동(타)]reach [sb]: figurative (contact by telephone) (비유: 전 | 화로)~에게 연락하다
Example: I'll have wine rather than beer with my dinner. If you have a | problem at school, it's worth speaking to your teacher rather | than keeping quiet about it. | The movie is more of a thriller rather than a horror film. | Have you reached Philadelphia yet? If not, keep driving. | Can you reach the glasses on the top shelf? | Let me see if I can reach him to ask him about the party. | The train reached its destination on time.

Meaning: [동(타)]reach [sth] (plane, train: arrive at)~에 도착하다 | [동(타)]reach [sth](extend: in distance)~에 닿다 | [동(타)]reach [sth] (limit, level: attain)~에 도달하다 | [동(타)]reach [sth] (live to be: a given age) (나이)~가 되다 | [동(자)]reach for [sth] (move to take)~을 잡다 | [명](arm's length)손의 뻗침 | [동(자)](person, animal)반응하다 | [동(자)]react to [sth] (person, animal) (사람, 동물 등이)~에 반
Example: His legs were so long they reached the end of the bed. | The temperature is expected to reach 30°C today. | He felt lucky to have reached the age of ninety. | He reached for the book. | The glasses on the top shelf are beyond her reach. | John reacted badly when he heard the news. | Workers reacted to the news of planned job losses by staging | a strike.

Meaning: 응하다 | [동(자)](chemistry) (화학)반응하다 | [동(자)](respond to a drug) (약물이나 치료 등에)반응하다
Example: These two substances react with each other. | The patient reacted well to the treatment and is now getting | better.

Meaning: [동(타)]realize how/what/who, also UK: realise how/what/who | (be aware)~을 실감하다, 이해하다, 알다 | [동(타)]realize [sth], also UK: realise [sth] (fulfil, make real)~ | 을 실현하다 | [동(타)]receive [sth] (get, take) (배달된 것을)~을 받다, ~을 수 | 령하다 | [동(타)]receive [sth] (be given: a gift) (선물을)~을 받다

Meaning: [동(타)]receive [sth] (be granted)~가 주어지다, (뉴스, 정보 등) | ~을 듣다, ~을 받다 | [동(타)]receive [sth] (get: radio or TV signal) (TV, 라디오 등 | 전파를)~을 수신하다, (교육,훈련 등) ~을 경험하다, ~을 받다

[부](in the recent past)최근에, 근래에 | They were recently married. | [명](welcoming)환영, 접대, 응접 | [명](response: to idea, news)반응

Meaning: [명](TV, radio: clarity of signal) (TV, 라디오의)수신 상태 | [명](wedding party) (결혼식)피로연 | [명](front desk of office or hotel)리셉션 데스크, 카운터 | [명](food)조리법, 레시피

Meaning: [명]figurative (means to an end)비결, 비법 | [동(타)]recognize [sb/sth], also UK: recognise [sb/sth] | (identify)알아보다, 분간하다, 인지하다 | [동(타)]recognize [sth], also UK: recognise [sth] (admit, | concede [sth])~을 인정하다, ~을 받아들이다 | [동(타)]recognize that, also UK: recognise that (with clause: | concede that)~을 인정하다, ~을 받아들이다 | [동(타)]recognize [sth], also UK: recognise [sth] (reward | [sth])~을 인정하다, ~을 표창하다

Meaning: [동(타)]recognize [sb/sth], also UK: recognise [sb/sth] (admit | status)~을 인정하다, ~을 받아들이다 | [동(타)]recognize [sb/sth], also UK: recognise [sb/sth] (admit | validity)~의 가치를 인정하다, 효력을 인정하다 | [동(타)]recognize [sth], also UK: recognise [sth] (admit | independence) (독립)~을 인정하다, ~을 승인하다 | [동(타)]recognize [sb], also UK: recognise [sb]: formal (allow | [sb] to speak)~에게 발언권을 주다 | [동(타)]recommend [sth], recommend that (advise)~을 권하 | 다, ~을 권고하다, ~을 충고하다
Example: He was recognized as leader. | Most countries recognize the Geneva Conventions. | The government officially recognized the new country. | The chair recognizes the delegate. | His lawyers recommended that he settle quickly. | I recommend calling a plumber rather than trying to fix it

Meaning: [동]recommend doing [sth] (suggest, advise)~을 제안하다 | [동(타)]recommend [sth], recommend [sth] to [sb] (endorse)~ | 을 ~에게 추천하다 | [명](written account) (문서)기록 | [명](history)역사 기록, (학교)성적, (범죄)전과기록

Example: bottle bank every week. | This author used to be good, but now she just recycles the | same material in all her books. | If you care about the environment, you should recycle.

Meaning: 다, ~을 ~로 낮추다 | [동(타)]reduce [sth] (lower the quantity of)~을 줄이다 | [동(타)]reduce [sth] to [sth] (lower the quantity to) (양)~을 ~로 | 줄이다 | [동(타)]reduce [sth] (copy: make smaller)~을 축소하다 | [동(자)](lessen, decrease)감소하다, 줄어들다 | [동(자)]refer to [sth/sb] (mention, allude to)~을 언급하다, ~에 | 대해 언급하다 | [동(자)]refer to [sth/sb] (be about, concern)~에 관한 것이다 | [동(자)]refer to [sth](consult)~을 참고하다 | [동(자)]refer to [sb] as [sth] (call: [sb] [sth])~을 ~라고 부르다, | ~을 ~라고 칭하다
Example: its product. | Ian is giving up smoking and has reduced the number of | cigarettes he smokes each day to three. | I need to reduce this A3 poster so that it will fit onto a sheet of | A4. | The number of visitors to this town has reduced in recent | years. | Twain was referring to Shakespeare. | What does this call refer to? | He referred to his notes. | People refer to Emily as "The Queen" because she always | gets her way.

Meaning: [동(타)]refer [sb] to [sb] (send to an expert) (전문가에게)~에 | 게 ~을 추천하다, ~에게 ~을 문의하다 | [동(타)]refer [sth] to [sb] ([sth]: direct, send on)~을 ~에게 상담 | 하다, ~을 ~에게 문의하다 | [동(타)]refer [sb] to [sb] (medical: send to specialist)~을 ~에게 | 보내다 | [동(타)]refer [sb] (suggest as a customer)~을 소개하다 | [동(타)]refuse [sth] (offer: decline) (제의, 제안)~을 거절하다, | ~을 거부하다 | [동(타)]refuse [sth] ([sth] offered: not take)~을 사절하다, ~을 | 사양하다
Example: Bob referred me to you, saying that you are the best lawyer | here. | I'll refer the matter to my lawyer. | The doctor referred me to a specialist. | Refer a friend and win $20! | Mrs. Bixby refused his offer to help her with her bags. | David refused a second piece of pizza, saying that he wasn't | very hungry.

Meaning: [동]refuse to do [sth] (say no) (의뢰, 요구)~을 하려하지 않다, | ~을 하는 것을 거절하다, ~을 하는 것을 거부하다 | [동(자)](not comply)거부하다 | [동(자)](not consent)거부하다, 퇴짜를 놓다 | [명](rubbish, [sth] discarded)쓰레기 | [명](territory)지역, 지방, (연구나 활동 등의 분야) 범위, 영역
Example: The child refused to eat his spinach. | They asked me to lie for them, and I refused. | I wanted to pay by credit card, but they refused. | A pile of refuse littered the kitchen corner. | Smith explored unmapped regions of the continent.

Meaning: [명](area)지역 | [명](zone)지역, 지방, 구역 | [형](normal, usual)평소의 | [형](habitual)일상적인 | [형](coming on time)정시에 오는, 정시의 | [형](occurring evenly)규칙적인
Example: The rain in this region can cause floods. | We should travel through the peaceful regions of the country. | Tamsin's regular hairdresser was on holiday, so she had to | make an appointment with someone else. | The vicar paid his regular weekly visit to his two elderly | parishioners. | Bert was waiting for the regular 8.30 bus.

Meaning: [형](symmetrical)균형이 잡힌 | [형](grammar: following pattern) (문법)규칙적인 | [형](organization: proper, correct)올바른, 제대로 이루어지는 | [형](standard)보통의, 표준의 | [명](family connection) (가족)관계 | [명](romantic involvement) (애인과의)관계
Example: The doctor asked Linda if she had regular periods. | Arabella's face had regular features. | The inflections of this verb are regular. | It's Tim's job to ensure the regular operation of the systems in | the factory. | I just want a regular kettle, nothing fancy. | What is her relationship to you? Is she a cousin? | We have been in a relationship for three years and we plan to | get married.

Meaning: [명](logical connection) (논리적 연결성)관계 | [명](tie, connection to [sth]) (연줄)관련 | [동(타)]remove [sth] from [sth] (take out)~을 ~에서 빼내다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] from [sth] (take away)~을 ~에서 치우다, | 제거하다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] (take out)~을 꺼내다, ~을 빼내다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] (eliminate)~을 제거하다
Example: Is there a relationship between car exhaust fumes and global | warming? | Do you have any relationship with the company that you are | recommending to us? | She removed the pan from the oven. | The cleaning firm removed all the rubbish from the house. | After the cleaners removed the wine stain, the couch looked | brand new again. | We need to remove this step in the process to make it easier.

Meaning: [동(타)]remove [sth] (excise, edit out)~을 삭제하다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] (stain, make-up: clean off)~을 지우다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] from [sth] (stain, make-up: clean off)~에 | 서 ~을 지우다 | [동(타)]remove [sth] (clothing: take off) (옷)~을 벗다
Example: This is a magazine for the whole family, so our editors | remove offensive language. | Phoebe removes her makeup every night with natural oils. | You can use white wine to remove red wine stains from a | carpet. | She removed her clothes before getting in the shower.

Meaning: [명](fixed part)수리한 부분 | [명](condition)상태 | [동(타)]replace [sth] (put back)~을 돌려 놓다 | [동(타)]replace [sth], replace [sth] with [sth] (substitute)~을 ~
Example: does car repairs. | The repair to the table lasted a month, but then it broke | again. | This car is in poor repair. The building is old, but in good | repair. | Please replace the lid after use.

Meaning: 로 교체하다 | [동(타)]replace [sb], replace [sb] as [sth] ([sb]: in job, | position)~을 대신하다 | [명](verbal answer)대답, 응답, 대꾸 | [명](written: letter of response)답장 | [명](response)반응
Example: I finally replaced my old typewriter with a computer. | Joyce has replaced Carl as finance director. | His reply was a simple "Yes". | Have we received a reply from the client yet? | When Delia greeted the audience, there was no reply.

Meaning: [동(자)]reply to [sb/sth] (answer, respond)~에게 답하다 | [동(타)]reply, reply that (answer, say in response)~라고 대답 | 하다, ~라고 응답하다, ~라고 대꾸하다 | [명](TV: news correspondent)기자
Example: He did not reply to me. | "Yes", he replied. I replied that I was grateful for the invitation | but too busy to attend. | We go now to our reporter on the scene in Khartoum.

Meaning: [명](newspaper: journalist)기자, 신문 기자 | [동(타)]request [sth] (ask for [sth])~을 요구하다 | [동(타)]request that (ask that [sth] be done)~을 요구하다 | [명](solicitation)요청
Example: She's the finance reporter for the Washington Post. | She requested more time to finish the report. | He requested that she finish the work by Friday. | The request was denied for lack of funds.

Meaning: [명](written petition)청원서 | [명](computing: instruction) (컴퓨터)명령 | [명]([sth] asked for)요구한 것 | [명]uncountable (investigation)연구, 조사, 탐구
Example: The request was forwarded to the company president for his | signature. | We are unable to process your request. Try again later. | What is his request? A pen and paper? Give it to him. | The scientist is conducting research.

Meaning: [동(타)]research [sth] (investigate)~을 연구하다, ~을 조사하다 | [명](investigative scientist)연구원
Example: The police will research the suspect's record. | Researchers in England confirmed the Russians' results.

Meaning: [명](person who gathers information)조사원 | [동(자)](answer, reply)대답하다, 답장하다 | [동(자)]respond to [sb/sth] (answer, reply to)~에 대답하다
Example: Several outside researchers worked on the story. | When he is unsure of the answer to a question, he does not | respond. | She responded to our letter immediately.

Meaning: [동(자)]respond to [sth] (react)~에 반응하다 | [동(자)]respond to [sth] (be cured by)~후에 차도나 효과를 보 | 이다 | [명](reply)응답, 대답, 답
Example: He responded negatively to my critique. | The good news is that the cancer seems to be responding to | the chemotherapy. | Give me a response by tomorrow.

Meaning: [명](reaction) (심리등 자극에 대한)반응 | [명](remainder)나머지 | [명](relaxation)휴식 | [명]US (sleep)수면
Example: His response was to get angry. | Eat what you can and I'll have the rest. | You can't work all the time; some rest is essential if you want | to stay healthy. | Seven hours' rest is the minimum I can function on.

Meaning: [명](peace)안정 | [명](absence of motion)정지 | [동(자)](relax)쉬다 | [동(자)](stop, take a break)쉬기위해 멈추다 | [동(타)]review [sth] (check, read)~을 검토하다 | [동(타)]review [sth] (re-examine)~을 다시 조사하다 | [동(타)]review [sth]: US (revise lessons)~을 복습하다 | [동(타)]review [sth] (critique, analyse)~을 비평하다
Example: Yes, please take the children out of the house. I could use | the rest. | The car accelerates quickly from rest. | I rested today instead of going out. | Can we rest for a while or do we need to keep walking? | Can you review my message before you send it? | Let me review what happened to see if we can do anything | about it. | I'm reviewing my geography for a quiz tomorrow. | The reporter reviewed the new product for the newspaper. | The review did not say many good things about this car.

Meaning: [명](article: critique)비평, 평론 | [명](hotel, service, etc.: customer's report)평가, 후기 | [명](analysis)재조사, 분석 | [명](examination)검사, 검토
Example: The hotel has had a hundred reviews, only two of them | negative. | Her review of the scientific study found no problems with the | reasoning or methods used. | He undertook a thorough review of the company's computer | security.
